verses.verse: (The Way of Wisdom) Wisdom has ((Matt. 16:18; 1 Cor. 3:9, 10; Eph. 2:20-22; 1 Pet. 2:5)) built her house, She has hewn out her seven pillars;
(Matt. 22:4) She has slaughtered her meat, (Prov. 23:30) She has mixed her wine, She has also furnished her table.
She has sent out her maidens, She cries out from the highest places of the city,
“Whoever (Ps. 19:7) is simple, let him turn in here!” As for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
“Come, (Song 5:1; Is. 55:1; (John 6:27)) eat of my bread And drink of the wine I have mixed.
Forsake foolishness and live, And go in the way of understanding.
“He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, And he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.
(Prov. 15:12; Matt. 7:6) Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; (Ps. 141:5; Prov. 10:8) Rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.
Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; Teach a just man, ((Matt. 13:12)) and he will increase in learning.
“The (Job 28:28; Ps. 111:10; Prov. 1:7) fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
(Prov. 3:2, 16) For by me your days will be multiplied, And years of life will be added to you.
(Job 35:6, 7; Prov. 16:26) If you are wise, you are wise for yourself, And if you scoff, you will bear it alone.”
(The Way of Folly) (Prov. 7:11) A foolish woman is clamorous; She is simple, and knows nothing.
For she sits at the door of her house, On a seat (Prov. 9:3) by the highest places of the city,
To call to those who pass by, Who go straight on their way:
“Whoever (Prov. 7:7, 8) is simple, let him turn in here”; And as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
“Stolen (Prov. 20:17) water is sweet, And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
But he does not know that (Prov. 2:18; 7:27) the dead are there, That her guests are in the depths of hell.
